alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued April 21 at 8:53PM EDT until April 21 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level along shorelines and tidal waterways (6.9 to 7.1 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...Until 11 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...This could result in some roads becoming impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 9:59 PM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible up to 15 or 30 minutes before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 21/10 PM 7.0 1.2 0.6 N/A Minor 22/10 AM 6.0 0.2 0.9 N/A None 22/11 PM 6.6 0.8 0.4 N/A None 23/11 AM 5.5 -0.3 0.7 N/A None 23/11 PM 6.5 0.7 0.7 N/A None 24/12 PM 5.4 -0.4 0.8 N/A None &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
